 Just thought you might like to know that this isn't a problem confined to those of you across that rather large pond that is the Atlantic.
 
 In the UK, a group called Truth in Science (pretentious name, homepage here), are setting up that ID should be taught in order to allow 'a critical approach to Darwinism in science lessons' (see article here)
 
 Seems to me this means one of two things. Either: The ID/fundie community (I draw no line between them, one is merely the others slightly smarter, more city-slick cousin) is getting frustrated in the US and has decided that they might have more chance of getting in through the British tradition of fair play (equal time to even the stupidest ideas, we've got a 'Jedi' in the House of Commons for ****'s sake), or the ID/fundie community is working on the 'Well, they teach it in Britain. Must be OK if they do it'. I don't know how well that one flies in the US, but it has some influence on Europe. It's perfectly possible that there's some longer game here, but I'm rather worried that some twit will actually let this in the classroom. At the moment, it's recognised for what it is, however will that last?
